intro: Bufonia teneriffae, commonly known as the Canary Islands bufonia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs. Bufonia teneriffae is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat.
